blocks.name: iseven5
blocks.content: The predicate "is an even number". An even number and 2 have 2 as greatest common divisor. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: isodd7
blocks.content: The predicate "is an odd number". An odd number and 2 have 1 as greatest common divisor. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: dfeven5
blocks.content: Alternate definition for even numbers. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfeven5(setvar s0) {
  |- wceq(ceven, crab(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2)))
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, ceven, crab(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2)))
  bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), ceven), wcel(cv(hs0), crab(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat2)))
  iseven5(cv(hs0))
  elrab(s0, cv(hs0), cz, wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2), wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat2))
  eqeq1d(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2, co(nat2, cgcd, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  oveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), nat2, cgcd)
  diff.hs0.c(ceven)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cz, wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, cv(s0)), nat2)))
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, co(nat2, cgcd, cv(hs0)), nat2)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat2, cgcd, cv(hs0))
  diff.cgcd.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dfeven5(setvar s0) {
  ⊢ Even = { s0 ∈ ℤ |(2[gcd]s0)= 2 }
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, ceven, { s0 ∈ ℤ |(2[gcd]s0)= 2 })
  bitr4i(hs0 ∈ Even, hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ ℤ |(2[gcd]s0)= 2 }, (hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧(2[gcd]hs0)= 2))
  iseven5(hs0)
  elrab(s0, hs0, cz, (2[gcd]s0)= 2, (2[gcd]hs0)= 2)
  eqeq1d((2[gcd]s0), nat2, (2[gcd]hs0), s0 = hs0)
  oveq2(s0, hs0, nat2, cgcd)
  diff.hs0.c(ceven)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ∈ ℤ |(2[gcd]s0)= 2 })
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, (2[gcd]hs0), nat2)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat2, cgcd, hs0)
  diff.cgcd.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: gcd2odd1
blocks.content: The greatest common divisor of an odd number and 2 is 1, i.e., 2 and any odd number are coprime. Remark: The proof using ~ dfodd7 is longer (see proof in comment)! (Contributed by AV, 5-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm gcd2odd1(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, codd), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, nat2), nat1))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, cgcd, nat2), nat1, co(nat2, cgcd, c0), wcel(c0, codd))
  sylancl(wcel(c0, codd), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, nat2), co(nat2, cgcd, c0)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(nat2, cz))
  2z()
  gcdcom(c0, nat2)
  mpbid(wcel(c0, codd), wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, c0), nat1), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0)))
  2ndvdsodd(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c0, codd), wb(wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0)), wceq(co(nat2, cgcd, c0), nat1)), wcel(nat2, cprime), wcel(c0, cz))
  2prm()
  oddz(c0)
  coprm(nat2, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm gcd2odd1(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Odd →(c0[gcd]2)= 1)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0[gcd]2), nat1, (2[gcd]c0), c0 ∈ Odd)
  sylancl(c0 ∈ Odd, (c0[gcd]2)=(2[gcd]c0), c0 ∈ ℤ, 2 ∈ ℤ)
  2z()
  gcdcom(c0, nat2)
  mpbid(c0 ∈ Odd, (2[gcd]c0)= 1, ¬ 2[||]c0)
  2ndvdsodd(c0)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ Odd, (¬ 2[||]c0 ↔(2[gcd]c0)= 1), 2 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  2prm()
  oddz(c0)
  coprm(nat2, c0)
}
